data.meta_description: Congratulations the new PRTM Graduate Student Association team for the 2024 - 2025 academic year, including new PRTM GSA Co-Presidents Sweta Dixit and Kaylaâ€¦
data.text:
We are happy to present the new Executive Team at the Graduate Students' Association of Concordia University (GSA). Each member brings a unique vision and passion to help change the student community graduate experience for the better. Meet the team, from left to right: Vice-President Internal, Vijayraagavan Vijayathirupathi: "I joined to contribute to Concordia's graduate academic community and enhance student life at the university. My goals include improving GSA operations, fostering community, and addressing student needs effectively." President, Sai Abhinav Tadepalli: "Joining the GSA will allow me to engage with a diverse group, influence policies, organize events, and create networking opportunities. My goals are to enhance communication, foster community, support academic and professional development, and promote sustainability." Vice-President External, Venkata Sai Pavan Kumar Maniyambakam: "I aim to enhance student life and foster a vibrant community. My goals are to create inclusive events, expand mental health resources, and improve career development opportunities." Vice-President Mobilization, Aditya Thakkar: "I joined to impact the graduate community through leadership. My goals include amplifying student voices, improving support services, and fostering a vibrant, supportive community." Vice-President Academic, Duraipaandiyaan A P: "Passionate about decision-making and advocacy, my goals are to ensure student voices are heard, improve communication, and develop academic and career programs. I aim to enhance course consistency, financial literacy, and student engagement." #CommunityFirst! Stay tuned for exciting initiatives and events! ðŸŒŸ

Yesterday in Washington, DC, CAAHEP President Donald Balasa, JD, MBA, delivered an enlightening session on "Beyond Gainful Employment: Other Title IV Rule Revisions that Impact Quality and Eligibility" at the prestigious CHEA/CIQG Annual Conference. The landscape of higher education and the implications of Title IV of the Higher Education Act (HEA) are evolving, and Balasa's talk shed light on crucial changes every professional program must be aware of. Key takeaways include: -Ensuring graduates are eligible for mandatory state licensing/certification exams. -Avoiding the inclusion of courses that are unnecessary for meeting state licensing/certification requirements. For students to benefit from Title IV assistance, these stipulations underscore the dual necessity for compliance and quality in the curriculum of our professional programs. This conversation is vital for maintaining the integrity of our educational frameworks. Join the dialogue and share your perspectives on how these revisions may shape the future of professional education!

Wondering if a career in Education is right for you? In our latest blog we share eight reasons to join the Chester School of Education with a Childhood or Education degree. From exciting international opportunities where you can gain confidence and independence while experiencing new cultures, to our practical teaching and assessment styles which prepare you for a real-world setting. There are plenty of reasons to choose UoC as you embark on your first steps to a career in Education! Check out the blog here https://bit.ly/3UtF9b0

Colleagues and friends, Will I see you at the NASPA - Student Affairs Administrators in Higher Education national conference this year? Please send me a message and let's try to connect. One of my major efforts this year is developing a professional development template and plan for student services staffers at SPH. I know that having NASPA in town will be a huge win for collecting resources, references, leads, and connections toward that end. Anyway, hmu. Best, JR #NASPA #studentdevelopment #studentaffairs #studentservices #graduatestudents #professionaldevelopment

Presenters Needed for Virtual Professional Development The NASPA Faculty Council is accepting proposals from higher education and student affairs instructors to share effective teaching practices as part of our virtual professional development offerings for Spring 2024. We have identified three specific areas that we would like to offer professional development in, but will also consider other topical areas: 1. Centering Black liberation thought in higher education and student affairs coursework 2. Infusing Indigenous learning theory throughout higher education and student affairs coursework 3. Sentipensante theory in higher education and student affairs work 4. Other (such as, effective engagement strategies, uses of instructional technology, course design, learning assessments that prioritize equity in the classroom, etc.) We are seeking presenters with expertise in these areas to describe how to effectively utilize these approaches in higher education and student affairs teaching. A $1000 honorarium will be provided to the presenter for their time and labor. If more than one presenter is included in your proposal, the honorarium will be split evenly among all presenters. Please use the following form to provide a brief overview of your proposed professional development session and available dates to present by February 15th, 2024. The NASPA Faculty Council Professional Development subcommittee will review the submissions and follow up with selected presenters by February 29, 2024. #naspa #facultydevelopment #facultycouncil #highered https://lnkd.in/gzxdAJhQ

ðŸŒ¿ Did you know Seattle's enchanting nickname, "The Emerald City," is inspired by its lush greenery that flourishes throughout the year? I'm thrilled to be on my way to Seattle, ready to immerse myself in the NASPA - Student Affairs Administrators in Higher Education conference. It's an opportunity to grow, learn, and connect with my higher ed colleagues. In my latest blog post, "Beyond the Badge: NASPA in the Emerald City," I share my strategies for maximizing the value of these precious days. Dive into the conversation in today's blog: https://lnkd.in/eeeweJez
